Write a summary about 'astronomy'. Limit the output to 200 words. Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects, spaces, and phenomena that originate outside Earth's atmosphere. It encompasses the origin, evolution, properties, and interactions of celestial bodies, like stars, planets, galaxies, and black holes. Astronomers use observations, mathematics, physics, and chemistry to explain the universe's structure and behavior. They study the universe's origin and evolution, from the Big Bang to the present day. Key tools include telescopes, satellites, and space probes, with discoveries often made through observing electromagnetic radiation, such as light, radio waves, and X-rays. Astronomy plays a fundamental role in our understanding of the cosmos, pushing the boundaries of knowledge and inspiring generations.

It involves the observation, description, measurement, and interpretation of the physical properties and behavior of stars, planets, galaxies, and other celestial bodies. Astronomers study a wide range of phenomena, including the formation of galaxies, the evolution of stars, the nature of black holes, and the search for extraterrestrial life. Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects (such as stars, galaxies, planets, and more) and phenomena that originate outside Earth's atmosphere. It involves physics, mathematics, and chemistry. Key areas include observing, theory, and computation. Observations are made using various instruments, like telescopes, to gather electromagnetic radiation. Theoretical astronomy uses models to predict phenomena and interpret observations. Computational astronomy uses computers to analyze and visualize data, and to simulate astrophysical processes. Major topics include the formation and evolution of celestial bodies, the origin and evolution of the universe, and the properties of matter under extreme conditions.

Astronomy is the study of objects and events in space, like stars, planets, and galaxies. It uses science like physics, math, and chemistry to understand how these things began and changed over time. Astronomy has many parts, such as studying the Sun (solar astronomy) and planets (planetary science). We also study things like black holes and planets around other stars (exoplanets). To see these, we use big telescopes on Earth and in space. These telescopes see different types of light, like the light we can see and special kinds we can't see with our eyes. Recent discoveries include finding waves caused by black holes (gravitational waves), water on the Moon, and the first picture of a black hole. Astronomy makes us curious and want to learn more about the universe.

Write a summary about 'astronomy'. Limit the output to 200 words. Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects and phenomena that originate outside Earth's atmosphere. It is one of the oldest natural sciences, with historical roots in astrology, philosophy, religion, and mythologies of many cultures. Modern astronomy uses mathematics, physics, and chemistry to explain the origins and evolution of objects and events in the universe. Key areas of study include cosmology, the study of the universe as a whole; planetary science, focusing on planets and other celestial bodies within our solar system; and astrophysics, which applies the principles of physics and chemistry to astronomical problems. Astronomy also involves the observation of celestial bodies, including stars, galaxies, and nebulae, using various techniques such as spectroscopy, photometry, and astrophotography.
